details.purpose: For the recording and reporting of the patient reported results of the Subjective knee evaluation score developed by the International Knee Documentation Committee.
details.use:
Use to record the patient reported results of the Subjective knee evaluation score developed by the International Knee Documentation Committee.
While openEHR archetypes are all freely available under an open license, the specific content of this archetype may be copyright protected. Any use of this archetype within implementations must be in compliance with the terms established by the copyright owners where a copyright exists.
details.misuse: Not to be used unless the terms of copyright have been observed (if a copyright exists).

items.items: IKDC subjective knee evaluation
International Knee Documentation Committee (IKDC) Subjective knee evaluation score.
History
Point in time
A specific date and/or time which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
ItemTree
@ internal @
ItemTree
@ internal @
Extension
Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
Highest level of activity without pain
Patient reported highest level of activity they can perform without significant knee pain.
Unable to perform any activities
Patient reports that they are unable to perform any activities due to knee pain.
Light activities
Patient reports that they are able to perform light activities like walking, housework or gardening.
Moderate activities
Patient reports that they are able to perform moderate activities like moderate physical work, running or jogging.
Strenuous activities
Patient reports that they are able to perform strenuous activities like heavy physical work, skiing or tennis.
Very strenuous activities
Patient reports that they are able to perform very strenuous activities like jumping or pivoting as in gymnastics or football.
Symptoms
Patient reported extent of symptoms due to knee pain.
Frequency of pain
Patient reported frequency of pain during past 4 weeks or since injury where 0 represents never and 10 represents constant.
Severity of pain
Patient reported severity of pain where 0 represents no pain and 10 represents worst pain imaginable.
Stiff or swollen knee
Patient reported degree of stiffness or swelling of knee during past 4 weeks or since injury.
Extremely
Patient reports that knee has been extremely stiff or swollen during past 4 weeks or since injury.
Very
Patient reports that knee has been very stiff or swollen during past 4 weeks or since injury.
Moderately
Patient reports that knee has been moderately stiff or swollen during past 4 week or since injury.
Mildly
Patient reports that knee has been mildly stiff or swollen during past 4 weeks or since injury.
Not at all
Patient reports that knee has not at all been stiff or swollen during past 4 weeks or since injury.
Highest level of activity without swelling
Patient reported highest level of activity they can perform without significant swelling in knee.
Unable to perform any activities
Patient reports that they are unable to perform any activities due to knee swelling.
Light activities
Patient reports that they are able to perform light activities like walking, housework or gardening.
Moderate activities
Patient reports that they are able to perform moderate activities like moderate physical work, running or jogging.
Strenuous activities
Patient reports that they are able to perform strenuous activities like heavy physical work, skiing or tennis.
Very strenuous activities
Patient reports that they are able to perform very strenuous activities like jumping or pivoting as in gymnastics or football.
Locked or caught
Patient indicates if knee has locked or caught in the past 4 weeks.
Question: During the past 4 weeks, or since your injury, has your knee locked or caught?
Highest level of activity without giving way
Patient reported highest level of activity they can perform without significant giving way in their knee.
Question: What is the highest level of activity you can perform without significant giving way in your knee?
Unable to perform any activities
Patient reports that they are unable to perform any activities due to knee pain.
Light activities
Patient reports that they are able to perform light activities like walking, housework or gardening.
Moderate activities
Patient reports that they are able to perform moderate activities like moderate physical work, running or jogging.
Strenuous activities
Patient reports that they are able to perform strenuous activities like heavy physical work, skiing or tennis.
Very strenuous activities
Patient reports that they are able to perform very strenuous activities like jumping or pivoting as in gymnastics or football.
Sport Activities
Patient reported impact on sporting activities undertaken due to knee pain.
Highest level of activity you can participate in
Patient reported highest level of activity they can participate in on a regular basis.
Question: What is the highest level of activity you can participate in on a regular basis?
Unable to perform any activities
Patient reports that they are unable to perform any activities on a regular basis.
Light activities
Patient reports that they are able to perform light activities like walking, housework or gardening on a regular basis.
Moderate activities
Patient reports that they are able to perform moderate activities like moderate physical work, running or jogging on a regular basis.
Strenuous activities
Patient reports that they are able to perform strenuous activities like heavy physical work, skiing or tennis on a regular basis.
Very strenuous activities
Patient reports that they are able to perform very strenuous activities like jumping or pivoting as in gymnastics or football on a regular basis.
How does knee affect your ability to
Collection of questions relating to the patients ability to participate in various activities.
Go up stairs
Patient reported ability to go up stairs.
Unable to do
The patient is unable to perform the activity.
Extremely difficult
The patient finds it extremely difficult to perform the activity.
Moderately difficult
The patient finds it moderately difficult to perform the activity.
Minimally difficult
The patient finds it minimally difficult to perform the activity.
Not difficult at all
The patient finds it not difficult at all to perform the activity.
Go down stairs
Patient reported ability to go down stairs.
Unable to do
The patient is unable to perform the activity.
Extremely difficult
The patient finds it extremely difficult to perform the activity.
Moderately difficult
The patient finds it moderately difficult to perform the activity.
Minimally difficult
The patient finds it minimally difficult to perform the activity.
Not difficult at all
The patient finds it not difficult at all to perform the activity.
Kneel on front of knee
Patient reported ability to kneel on front of knee.
Unable to do
The patient is unable to perform the activity.
Extremely difficult
The patient finds it extremely difficult to perform the activity.
Moderately difficult
The patient finds it moderately difficult to perform the activity.
Minimally difficult
The patient finds it minimally difficult to perform the activity.
Not difficult at all
The patient finds it not difficult at all to perform the activity.
Squat
Patient reported ability to squat.
Unable to do
The patient is unable to perform the activity.
Extremely difficult
The patient finds it extremely difficult to perform the activity.
Moderately difficult
The patient finds it moderately difficult to perform the activity.
Minimally difficult
The patient finds it minimally difficult to perform the activity.
Not difficult at all
The patient finds it not difficult at all to perform the activity.
Sit with your knee bent
Patient reported ability to sit with your knee bent.
Unable to do
The patient is unable to perform the activity.
Extremely difficult
The patient finds it extremely difficult to perform the activity.
Moderately difficult
The patient finds it moderately difficult to perform the activity.
Minimally difficult
The patient finds it minimally difficult to perform the activity.
Not difficult at all
The patient finds it not difficult at all to perform the activity.
Rise from a chair
Patient reported ability to rise from a chair.
Unable to do
The patient is unable to perform the activity.
Extremely difficult
The patient finds it extremely difficult to perform the activity.
Moderately difficult
The patient finds it moderately difficult to perform the activity.
Minimally difficult
The patient finds it minimally difficult to perform the activity.
Not difficult at all
The patient finds it not difficult at all to perform the activity.
Run straight ahead
Patient reported ability to run straight ahead.
Unable to do
The patient is unable to perform the activity.
Extremely difficult
The patient finds it extremely difficult to perform the activity.
Moderately difficult
The patient finds it moderately difficult to perform the activity.
Minimally difficult
The patient finds it minimally difficult to perform the activity.
Not difficult at all
The patient finds it not difficult at all to perform the activity.
Jump and land on your involved leg
Patient reported ability to jump and land on your involved leg.
Unable to do
The patient is unable to perform the activity.
Extremely difficult
The patient finds it extremely difficult to perform the activity.
Moderately difficult
The patient finds it moderately difficult to perform the activity.
Minimally difficult
The patient finds it minimally difficult to perform the activity.
Not difficult at all
The patient finds it not difficult at all to perform the activity.
Stop and start quickly
Patient reported ability to stop and start quickly.
Unable to do
The patient is unable to perform the activity.
Extremely difficult
The patient finds it extremely difficult to perform the activity.
Moderately difficult
The patient finds it moderately difficult to perform the activity.
Minimally difficult
The patient finds it minimally difficult to perform the activity.
Not difficult at all
The patient finds it not difficult at all to perform the activity.
Function
Patient reported knee function before injury and current state.
Function prior
Patient reported function prior to knee injury where 0 represents couldn't perform daily activities and 10 represents no limitation in daily activities.
Function current
Patient reported current knee function where 0 represents couldn't perform daily activities and 10 represents no limitation in daily activities.
Total score
Total score from Questions 1 to 10
Total score as percentage
Total score from all questions as a percentage.
